IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO PROVIDE QUALITY FINANCIAL SERVICES TO MEMBERS.
IRS990.MissionDesc: TO PROVIDE QUALITY FINANCIAL SERVICES TO MEMBERS
IRS990.Desc: FINANCIAL SERVICES - BANKING ACTIVITIES, INCLUDING LOANS AND DEPOSITS. TOTAL MEMBERSHIP TO THE CREDIT UNION GREW TO 81,283 IN 2021, AN INCREASE OF 2,943 FOR THE YEAR. DURING 2021, THE CREDIT UNION AND ITS AFFILIATES FUNDED $192 MILLION IN CONSUMER LOANS.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: MORTGAGE SERVICES - ORIGINATING, SELLING, AND SERVICING OF REAL ESTATE MORTGAGES. DURING 2021, THE CREDIT UNION FUNDED $349 MILLION IN MORTGAGE LOANS.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: COMMERCIAL LENDING - ORIGINATING, SELLING, AND SERVICING OF COMMERCIAL LOANS. DURING 2021, THE CREDIT UNION FUNDED $353 MILLION IN COMMERCIAL LOANS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE GRANTS MADE ARE CONSIDERED CHARITABLE DONATIONS AND DO NOT REQUIRE FORMAL MONITORING OR REPORTING.

THE ORGANIZATION HAD A 457(F) DEFERRED COMPENSATION PLAN IN PLACE; JOYCE WHITNEY-SILVA WAS THE ONLY PARTICIPANT IN THE PLAN AND RECEIVED A TAXABLE DISTRIBUTION IN THE AMOUNT OF $692,631 FROM THE 457(F) PLAN DURING 2021.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 6
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE CREDIT UNION HAS ONE CLASS OF MEMBER, WHICH ARE: (I) SHAREHOLDERS OF THE CREDIT UNION WHO LIVE OR WORK IN THE FOLLOWING NEVADA COUNTIES: CARSON CITY, CHURCHILL, CLARK, DOUGLAS, ELKO, ESMERALDA, EUREKA, HUMBOLDT, LANDER, LINCOLN, LYON, MINERAL, NYE, PERSHING, STOREY, WASHOE, WHITE PINE; (II) SPOUSES OF PERSONS WHO DIED WHILE WITHIN THE FIELD OF MEMBERSHIP OF THIS CREDIT UNION; (III) EMPLOYEES OF THIS CREDIT UNION; (IV) PERSONS RETIRED AS PENSIONERS OR ANNUITANTS FROM THE ABOVE EMPLOYMENT; AND (V) MEMBERS OF THEIR IMMEDIATE FAMILIES. MEMBERS DO NOT RECEIVE SHARES OF PROFIT OTHER THAN THROUGH SHARE ACCOUNT DIVIDENDS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: FOR EACH VACANCY OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS, THE NOMINATING COMMITTEE FILES NOMINATIONS WITH THE SECRETARY OF THE CREDIT UNION AT LEAST 90 DAYS PRIOR TO THE ANNUAL MEETING. NOMINATIONS FOR VACANCIES MAY ALSO BE MADE BY MEMBERS OF THE ORGANIZATION VIA PETITION SIGNED BY 500 MEMBERS OR ONE PERCENT (1%) OF THE MEMBERSHIP ELIGIBLE TO VOTE AT MEETINGS OF THE MEMBERS, WHICHEVER IS SMALLER. SHOULD THERE BE A CONTESTED ELECTION, THE ELECTION IS THEN DETERMINED BY PLURALITY VOTE OPEN TO ALL MEMBERS OF THE ORGANIZATION ELIGIBLE TO VOTE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FORM 990 IS PREPARED BY AN INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTANT IN CONJUNCTION WITH THE ORGANIZATION'S EVP/CFO. THE EVP/CFO, WHO IS A MEMBER OF THE EXECUTIVE MANAGEMENT TEAM, THEN REVIEWS AND APPROVES THE FORM 990 PRIOR TO FILING WITH THE INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE PRESIDENT/CEO'S COMPENSATION IS DETERMINED BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS. COMPENSATION SURVEY DATA OBTAINED FROM OUTSIDE CONSULTANTS IS UTILIZED TO DETERMINE APPROPRIATE SALARY AND BENEFIT LEVELS FOR THE PRESIDENT/CEO. SUCH DECISIONS ARE DOCUMENTED BY THE BOARD IN AN EXECUTIVE SESSION. THIS PROCESS WAS LAST COMPLETED IN APRIL 2021.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE CREDIT UNION'S MONTHLY FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE POSTED IN EACH OF THE CREDIT UNION'S BRANCHES. THE GOVERNING DOCUMENTS AND CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY ARE NOT MADE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, HEADING - SUMMARY OF CHANGES FOR AMENDED RETURN:
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: FORM 990, HEADING, BOX F: THE PRINCIPAL OFFICER WAS UPDATED TO REFLECT THE CURRENT PRINCIPAL OFFICER AS OF THE DATE OF THE AMENDED RETURN. FORM 990, PART IV, LINE 26: THIS LINE ITEM WAS UPDATED TO YES DUE TO A CONTRACT WITH HARDAWAY CAPITAL GROUP, LLC FOR THE SALE OF MEMBERSHIP INTEREST IN GREATER NEVADA COMMERCIAL LENDING, LLC. HARDAWAY CAPITAL GROUP, LLC IS A CONTROLLED ENTITY OF JEREMY GILPIN, A KEY EMPLOYEE AT GREATER NEVADA CREDIT UNION. FORM 990, PART IV, LINE 28C: THIS LINE ITEM WAS UPDATED TO YES FOR THE SALE OF A 25% INTEREST IN GREATER NEVADA COMMERCIAL LENDING, LLC TO HARDAWAY CAPITAL, LLC. FORM 990, PART X. LINE 5: THIS LINE ITEM WAS UPDATED TO $2,250,000 TO REFLECT THE NOTE RECEIVABLE IN THE CONTRACT WITH HARDAWAY CAPITAL GROUP, LLC. FORM 990, PART X, LINE 7: THIS LINE ITEM WAS REDUCED BY $2,250,000 TO RECLASSIFY THE NOTE RECEIVABLE IN THE CONTRACT WITH HARDAWAY CAPITAL GROUP, LLC TO LINE 5. SCHEDULE L, PART II: THIS WAS ADDED TO REPORT THE NOTE RECEIVABLE FROM HARDAWAY CAPITAL GROUP, LLC. SCHEDULE L, PART IV: THIS WAS ADDED TO REPORT THE SALE OF A 25% INTEREST IN GREATER NEVADA COMMERCIAL LENDING, LLC TO HARDAWAY CAPITAL, LLC.
